column4: Hi everyone. I just tried to resize my ubuntu partition from a live cd with gparted and something weird happened. It appeared to resize correctly, but then failed after copying all the information over giving me an error after trying "e2fsck /dev/sda3" saying "run e2fsck -f /dev/sda3 first". This stopped gparted and i tried booting into ubuntu (which I'm on now) and everything is fine except that my ubuntu installation is taking up 10 gb more t
: Run that command it asked from the terminal
: Thats an error and to correct it you can do that
